intro: Tragia finalis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Tragia finalis is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
